newsitem.title: INDONESIA: Duta Anggada, First Capital in joint venture.
newsitem.headline: Duta Anggada, First Capital in joint venture.

text.p: Indonesian property firm PT Duta Anggada Realty and First Capital Overseas of Singapore on Tuesday signed a joint venture agreement to develop a multi-use complex in Jakarta.
Duta Anggada Realty's president Hartadi Angkosubroto told an analyst meeting that both companies would control 50 percent of the shares of the new joint venture.
He said the total assets of the new venture would be $194 million.
The new venture would develop land adjacent to the Chase Plaza building in central Jakarta as well as 3.3 hectares of vacant land behind it into a hotel, office block and apartment complex.
Angkosubroto said the project would cost at $260 million. Construction is scheduled to start this year and the complex is expected to be operational by the year 2000, he added.
He said that because of funds received by the Duta Anggada from the new joint venture, the company expected to book a net profit of $115 million in 1997.
